snippet: A day after Israel temporarily suspended his indefinite detention, Mohammad Allan had officially agreed to give up his protest fast.
abstract: Mohammad Allan, attorney and member of Palestinian extremist group Islamic Jihad, ends two-month hunger strike one day after Israel's Supreme Court temporarily suspends administrative detention order under which he has been held since November; doctors report his medical condition, which was deteriorating, to be rapidly improving.
lead_paragraph: A day after Israel temporarily suspended his indefinite detention, Mohammad Allan had officially agreed to give up his protest fast.

headline.main: Palestinian Ends Hunger Strike, and His Condition Improves
headline.print_headline: Palestinian’s Condition Improves After He Ends Hunger Strike

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Adalah, The Legal Center for Arab Minority Rights in Israel
